"legendary horror author R.L. Stine

Onarrak unolom amol

translation.ko: - 알았어 - 여러분 슬래피가 테슬라 타워로 핼러윈 몬스터들을 살렸잖아요

translation.en: If I can get in there, maybe I can
shut it off, and we can save Mom.
translation.ko: 전원을 끄고 엄마를 구할 수도 있어요

translation.en: But there's monsters everywhere. How are we gonna get past them?
translation.ko: 사방에 몬스터가 깔렸는데 녀석들을 어떻게 통과해?

translation.en: Easy.
Camouflage.
Welcome to my crafts lab.
translation.ko: 내 공예 연구소에 온 걸 환영한다

translation.en: ♪ Let me tell you now I don't know how ♪
Jeez, they're still everywhere.
It's actually working.
Come on. We gotta get to that tower.
SONNY: I can't believe we're really here.
I can barely see out of this thing.
Is it cool? Is it awesome?
[WHISPERING] Hey, fanboy. Let's focus.
Right. Sorry.
Let's go.
SARAH [SOFTLY]: Don't. Move.
Come on, let's go. Come on!
Look at this place.
SARAH: It's so creepy.
Stay close.
SAM: No wonder Tesla abandoned this place.
Shh, shh, shh. Do you hear that?
Come on.
STINE: Oh, no.
Not Haunted Halloween.
Oh, my writing was so cliché back then.
translation.ko: 저 시절 내 글은 너무도 뻔했군

translation.en: I knew it! I knew I came up with that first.
translation.ko: 그럼 그렇지! 저건 내가 먼저 생각했다니까!

translation.en: That clever little dummy's writing his own ending.
translation.ko: 절 해치지 마세요 그 똑똑한 인형이 자신만의 결말을 쓰는군

translation.en: Not in my book, he's not.
Oh, gnomes.
Don't you dare.
Stay.
Ow! Son of a-- Ah!
Oh, witches!
Get away, witches!
SAM: Guys, do you hear that? Shh!
Welcome.
Slappy.
Walter? [GRUNTS]
Where's my mother?
Don't you mean our mother?
[IN RASPY VOICE] There's my sweet little babies.
I just love a family reunion.
Mom. What did you do?
SLAPPY: I had a papa once!
He let me down.
But a mother's love is forever.
Turn her back now, you psycho!
Oh, should I?
translation.ko: 엄마를 원래대로 돌려놔 이 사이코야! 그래야 하나?

translation.en: Unfortunately, I have other plans.
Walter! The book, please.
Yes.
This book.
Go prepare the tower!
I'm going to do what Stine couldn't:
translation.ko: 스타인은 못 하는 일을 내가 해내고 말겠어

translation.en: Finish this book, once and for all.
[CHUCKLES] Spoiler alert:
The manuscript gets destroyed in that tower,
and my Halloween family lasts forever!
translation.ko: 내 핼러윈 가족은 영원히 함께할 거야!

translation.en: Mama, babysit the children for me.
translation.ko: 내 핼러윈 가족은 영원히 함께할 거야! 엄마, 애들 좀 대신 봐줘요

translation.en: Yes, dear.
translation.ko: 엄마, 애들 좀 대신 봐줘요 그래, 아들아

translation.en: We can't let him destroy that book.
translation.ko: 그래, 아들아 저 책을 파괴하게 둘 순 없어

translation.en: Sonny, turn this thing off. I'm going after Slappy.
translation.ko: 서니, 이 기계를 꺼 난 슬래피를 쫓아갈게

translation.en: Just you and me now, Slappy.
Can't hear you. I'm too far ahead of you. Hee-hee-hee!
translation.ko: 안 들려, 난 훨씬 앞에 있잖아

translation.en: SONNY: This is amperage and this is voltage?
None of these cables make any sense.
translation.ko: 이 케이블들은 앞뒤가 전혀 안 맞는데

translation.en: What about here? Start pulling levers.
No, no, Sam, don't! Ah!
Slappy booby-trapped all this stuff.
Careful, Sarah. It'd be a shame to fall from that height.
translation.ko: 조심해, 세라 그 높이에서 떨어지면 망신스러울 거야

translation.en: Plenty more where that came from.
Come on, Sonny, turn this thing off.
Oh, no. Sonny hurry up.
translation.ko: 맙소사 서니, 서둘러 슬래피가 정상에 올라갔어

translation.en: Slappy's at the top. Do something.
translation.ko: 서니, 서둘러 슬래피가 정상에 올라갔어 뭐라도 해봐

translation.en: I can't do it, Sam.
Come on, Sonny. You are the smartest kid I know.
translation.ko: 힘내, 서니 너처럼 똑똑한 애는 없어

translation.en: Sam, I couldn't even do my little science project.
translation.ko: 샘, 난 고작 과학 과제도 완성 못 했어

translation.en: Slappy did that.
And even that one shorted out.
Wait. That's it.
We turn it up. All the way up. We blow the fuse.
translation.ko: 전력을 올리자 최대한으로 올려서 퓨즈를 날려버리는 거야

translation.en: Yes! The fuse is over there.
translation.ko: 최대한으로 올려서 퓨즈를 날려버리는 거야 - 좋았어! - 퓨즈는 저기 있어

translation.en: And now to finish this story and destroy the town.
translation.ko: 이제 이 이야기를 끝내고 이 마을을 파괴하자

translation.en: No!
What do you think you're doing?
Writing my own ending.
Spoiler alert: I save the town and put you back where you belong.
translation.ko: 스포일러 경고, 난 마을을 구하고 널 제자리로 돌려보낼 거야

translation.en: SLAPPY: What's the matter?
Writer's block?
Again?
Grab that lever. Yes. This one?
On my count, we push up at the same time.
translation.ko: 응, 내 신호에 맞춰서 동시에 올리자

translation.en: Ready? Go!
Give me the book.
You're not gonna get this book, Slappy.
I have a friend who might think otherwise.
translation.ko: 내 친구는 생각이 다를 것 같은데

translation.en: Nowhere else to run, sis!
Fine. You win, Slappy.
I'll give you the book, but you gotta turn my mom back.
translation.ko: 책을 줄 테니까 우리 엄마를 원래대로 돌려놔

translation.en: Deal.
It all ends Slappily ever after.
You forgot one thing:
Never judge a book by its cover.
What?
No!
[NORMALLY] Sonny, what's happening?
Mom.
We need to get out of here!
It's working!
Go, kids!
Hello?
Someone called for me?
KATHY: Sarah? Oh! Oh... Mom!
STINE: Hello?
I got your message. I'm here.
Don't worry. Everything's going to be okay.
I need typing paper, a thesaurus,
Diet Coke, and a quiet place to compose.
Preferably in a comfortable chair with lumbar support.
translation.ko: 허리 받침대가 달린 편안한 의자가 있으면 좋겠네요

translation.en: Are you R.L. Stine?
Me? No, I'm Dr. Seuss. R.L. Stine was unavailable.
translation.ko: 나? 아니, 난 닥터 수스야 R. L. 스타인은 바빠서

translation.en: Yes, of course, I'm R.L. Stine!
Then I guess this belongs to you.
Don't open it.
My first book.
You realize I wrote this when I was around your age.
translation.ko: 있잖아 난 네 또래일 때 이 책을 썼거든

translation.en: More of an amateur work, really, but I am sure you'll all agree
it shows the undeniable promise of a brilliant young writer.
translation.ko: 뛰어난 청소년 작가의 가능성을 엿볼 수 있단 걸

translation.en: Why do you have a typewriter?
I was going to save you with it,
although it appears you found a way to save yourselves.
translation.ko: 이걸로 너희를 구하려고 했거든 비록 너희 스스로 그 방법을 찾은 것 같지만

translation.en: A typewriter? It's been done before.
Once before.
Maybe twice.
Maybe more.
WALTER: Kathy?
Walter, manager at Fred's Pharmacy.
It's nice to see you.
Hi. It's nice to see you too.
translation.ko: 안녕하세요 저도 반가워요 여긴 어쩐 일이세요?

translation.en: What are you doing here?
I don't know.
translation.ko: 저도 반가워요 여긴 어쩐 일이세요? 저도 모르겠어요

translation.en: Walter! Walter! You got turned into a monster.
You were big, green, ugly. You were Slappy's henchman!
translation.ko: 못난 녹색 거인이자 슬래피의 부하가 됐죠

translation.en: Weather patterns. Very strange weather patterns.
translation.ko: 기후 패턴! 몹시 희한한 기후 패턴이 문제였는데

translation.en: But I think everything's back to normal now.
translation.ko: 이젠 모든 게 정상으로 돌아간 것 같군요

translation.en: Fine. Okay, yeah, the weather has been weird. It's true. Okay, thanks.
KATHY: What happened to your shirt?
WALTER: I don't know.
[IN PIG LATIN] Ixnay on the onsters-may.
Go ahead, ollow-fay. SONNY: What?
[IN ENGLISH] Means "follow." Pig Latin.
Oh, the youth today.
WALTER: So funny running into you.
Right? I always hoped we'd run into each other outside of work.
translation.ko: 그렇죠? 늘 가게 밖에서 우연히 만났으면 했거든요

translation.en: WALTER: Yeah, me too.
Hey, if you're not busy next week,
would you wanna have some dinner?
Yeah. Yeah, heh, heh. Yeah? That's awesome.
So they don't remember what happened to them?
translation.ko: 다들 무슨 일을 당했는지 기억 못 하세요?

translation.en: The transmutation process seems to have wiped their memories clean.
translation.ko: 변이 과정 중에 기억이 지워진 모양이다

translation.en: All those who were affected won't remember a thing.
translation.ko: 저들 중 이번 일을 기억하는 사람은 없을 거야

translation.en: Tommy?
SAM: Are you okay? Oh, my God. Guys.
I had this crazy dream.
I'm so glad to see you.
You know, can't believe I'm saying this,
translation.ko: 있잖아 이런 말을 하게 될 줄 몰랐지만 나도 만나서 반갑다, 토미

translation.en: but I'm glad to see you too, Tommy.
translation.ko: 이런 말을 하게 될 줄 몰랐지만 나도 만나서 반갑다, 토미

translation.en: Kids falling from the sky.
My work here is done.
I'm a writer too.
Well, an aspiring, very stuck writer at the moment.
translation.ko: 실은 작가 지망생이고 지금은 글이 전혀 안 써져요

translation.en: My condolences.
All the horrors in the world can't compare to the terrors of the blank page.
translation.ko: 이 세상 어떠한 두려움도 백지의 공포에 비할 순 없지

translation.en: Um, any advice on college essays?
translation.ko: 대학 지원 에세이를 쓰는데 조언해 주실 수 있나요?

translation.en: Well, first rule of writing: write what you know.
translation.ko: 글쓰기의 첫 번째 법칙은 아는 얘기를 쓰는 거지

translation.en: Thirty years, and I couldn't figure out
translation.ko: 글쓰기의 첫 번째 법칙은 아는 얘기를 쓰는 거지 난 30년간 이 책의 결말을 떠올리지 못했는데

translation.en: how this book should end.
translation.ko: 난 30년간 이 책의 결말을 떠올리지 못했는데

translation.en: And somehow you figured out how to finish it in one night.
translation.ko: 웬일인지 넌 하룻밤 만에 결말을 찾아냈잖아

translation.en: I believe in you.
Hm. "Write what you know."
SARAH: Recount a time in your life when you faced a fear, challenge or failure.
translation.ko: 공포나 난관, 실패에 직면했던 경험을 서술하라

translation.en: I think most of us are afraid that we don't have a story to tell.
translation.ko: 우린 대부분 할 얘기가 없어서 두려워하는 것 같다

translation.en: That there's nothing special about us.
translation.ko: 우리에겐 특별한 점이 없다고 생각하는 것이다

translation.en: And then a moment comes when you least expect it
where you have to step up, no matter how terrified you are.
translation.ko: 제아무리 겁에 질렸더라도 용기를 내야 할 때가 온다

translation.en: But what I've learned is that it's good to be scared sometimes.
translation.ko: 하지만 난 가끔은 겁먹어도 괜찮다는 걸 배웠다

translation.en: Scared of losing the people we love.
Stop, stop! It's a ventriloquist dummy.
Oh. Really?
That's not funny, Mom. Too soon.
No, I like it.
Congratulations, Sonny.
Thank you so much, Principal Harrison.
SARAH: Or scared of not achieving our dreams.
Because those moments remind us
just how special our stories really are.
Here's to us. Indeed.
Hey, Sarah! Hi, Mr. Chu.
CHU: Watch this.
[CHUCKLES] I like it.
Yeah, I just made it life-size this year.
You know, just in case.
No, seriously, you know, just in case.
Right. I'll see you later, Mr. Chu.
Bye!
SARAH: And maybe when you face enough of your fears
life stops being so scary after all.
translation.ko: 더는 인생이 두렵지 않을 수도 있다 "수신함 컬럼비아 대학교"

translation.en: Hey, honey.
What happened?
I got in.
I knew it. I knew you could do it.
translation.ko: 그럼 그렇지! 역시 합격할 줄 알았어

translation.en: Oh, I'm so proud of you!
I guess I'm proud.
Thanks, Sonny. Come on, bring it in.
Congratulations.
[CHUCKLES] Here, take off your jacket.
Guys, give her some ornaments, please.
Oh, yeah, yeah, yeah.
I'm so happy! Ha-ha-ha!
Here, put that right there. Yeah, I like that one.
Finally, a new book.
Yes.
SLAPPY: Hello, Papa.
Slappy! I thought the book got you.
Maybe those others, but not me.
Why is that?
You know I always survive.
You wrote me that way.
In fact, I wrote my own story while I was gone.
translation.ko: 실은 나도 요새 글을 좀 쓰고 있거든

translation.en: And guess what.
You're the main character.
No.
No!
You try living in a book for a while, Papa.
HAND: Hands off!
Hiya! Look at my candle.
SLAPPY: Slappy Halloween.
